ygData.subject: RE: Travel Tips - FP & Qeynos
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It s not a fish - it s a froglok, apparently of royal lineage given the name.  The frogloks in Upper Guk of about the same level drop research components,
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 24 Aug 1999, Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) wrote:
>
> > And just to epitomize how Verant discourages
> > anything but camping, all he had for loot was
> > a few silver and rawhide armbands.
>
> What would you expect a fish to carry? I agree
> that camping is a problem, but I believe some
> people expect inappropriate loot on some mobs.
> (Not to say that some mobs have loot that makes
> absolutely no sense, but still..)

It's not a fish - it's a froglok, apparently of royal lineage
given the name. The frogloks in Upper Guk of about the same
level drop research components, mesh, fine steel, and several
gold to 4pp. The named ones of same or lower level drop lots
of nice things like Ghoulbane, the shimmering orb, elf hide
gloves, etc. Is it too much to ask that a named, rare, high
level, wandering mob have loot similar to named, rare,
comparable level, campable mobs; for the benefit of those of
us who don't camp? Must we camp in order to get anything
decent?

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
